what happened yesterday?

Yesterday at the 6265 Ferry site, several key activities and updates happened:

- Joel Yanes attempted to install the vanity but did not finish, noting it requires two people. He plans to return tomorrow afternoon to complete it.
- Raul and his team were on-site working; however, Raul was at the shop during the day and is scheduled to install remaining cabinets tomorrow.
- The powder room faucet and an adjustable P-trap for plumbing trim are still outstanding, though expected to arrive soon.
- Vilma's crew came to re-measure after shelves returned and took fireplace slabs back for re-cutting related to shelves.
- Eric and his team were on-site performing testing and adjusting registers in the mudroom.
- A&G cleaned the home and organized materials, also covering countertops to protect them.
- Flooring in the powder room was reportedly finished by Ivan's crew.
- Some electrical trim work started with Carlos’ team.
- Appliances were moved to the garage, with installation planned soon but not yet completed.
- Discussions continued about coordinating electrical outlet placements, vent movements in the mudroom, and scheduling plywood board installation.
- The flooring under the vanity needs to be completed before vanity installation to avoid damage.
- Homeowners approved the heights for gas lanterns, which were being installed.
- The fireplace slab installation was delayed due to missing living room shelves but is active in planning.

Overall, progress was made on cabinetry, electrical trim, cleaning, and prep work, but some finishing tasks like vanity installation and plumbing trim await parts and coordination.

**Source:** Slack messages dated 5/5/2025.

summaries.content:
6265 Ferry – Weekly Summary • Week 2025-W18 – Week Ending April 29, 2025

  1. Key Achievements
    • Drywall team finished work and patched powder room drywall.
    • Appliances delivered and moved to garage with secured locking.
    • Wallpaper installation is in progress with water supply provided for installer.
    • Electric trim work started with Carlos’s team on site.
    • Gas lanterns installation heights approved by homeowners.
    • Living room shelves installed allowing fireplace slabs re-cut and reinstallation.
    • Cabinet installation continuing with Raul completing remaining cabinets soon.
    • Plywood boards for mirrors delivered and scheduled for installation.
    • Flooring in powder room finished; full flooring scheduled for next week starting Wednesday.
    • Site cleaned and materials organized by A&G with countertops covered.
  2. Issues or Blockers
    • Vanity installation delayed due to needing flooring completion first to avoid damage.
    • Joel Yanes unable to finish vanity install alone; requires two-man team and cabinets completion.
    • Powder room faucet and adjustable P-trap still awaited, delaying plumbing trim completion.
    • Master toilet length causing door swing obstruction; a smaller, shorter toilet will be ordered.
    • Fence alignment unresolved; property line issues require fence relocation or additional sections.
    • Need to move mudroom vent to accommodate cabinet overhang.
  3. Upcoming Work
    • Joel Yanes scheduled to return for trim out, vanity installation, and plywood board installation.
    • Electric trim and ceiling imperfection corrections planned for this and next week.
    • Flooring installation across the project scheduled to start next Wednesday through Thursday.
    • Vilma’s team to reinstall concrete fireplace slab after wall leveling work.
    • Irrigation hose bib installation initiating across multiple projects including Ferry.
    • Fence construction with modifications based on zoning and legal considerations.
    • Punch list items by Raul and patching drywall coordinated post electrical work.
  4. Action Items
    • Joel to coordinate with team for two-person job to complete vanity and trim installations.
    • Raul to complete cabinet installation and coordinate handle delivery with Rashad.
    • Taka and team to order shoe molding and verify plumbing trim material delivery.
    • Eric to complete testing and adjustment of registers and vents, including mudroom vent relocation.
    • Team to ensure all countertops and fixtures are properly covered during ongoing work.
    • Project manager to follow up on powder room faucet delivery and plumbing trim completion.
    • Site security team to maintain locked garage and secured home access points.
    • Decision needed on master bathroom toilet selection and door swing modifications.
    • Fence issues to be communicated with homeowners and zoning authorities for resolution.
    • Remove porta-john from site as work progresses toward completion.

6265 Ferry – Weekly Summary • Week 2025-W17 – Week Ending April 29, 2025

  1. Key Achievements
    • Drywall team completed work in the powder room.
    • Garage doors were installed.
    • Master tile and wallpaper installation in progress.
    • Plumbing trim is 70% complete.
    • Countertops were installed at 6265 Ferry Dr.
  2. Issues or Blockers
    • Fireplace wall is too bowed for installation; requires drywall correction.
    • Back door lock does not fully latch.
    • Kitchen Island pendants were installed incorrectly and need to be centered.
    • Discoloration issues with tile due to potential wrong thinset usage.
    • Operational motor for the garage needs replacement.
  3. Upcoming Work
    • Drywall team scheduled for Monday to fix fireplace wall.
    • Plumbing trim to start on Tuesday.
    • Gas lantern installation meeting on Monday.
    • Wallpaper installation for the powder room scheduled for Wednesday or Thursday.
    • Fireplace installation planned for May 1.
  4. Action Items
    • Joel to cover all countertops.
    • Order a smaller toilet for the master bathroom.
    • Freddy to review and potentially replace discolored tiles.
    • Raul to ensure cabinets align with original design specifications.
    • Behrouz to be scheduled for gas lantern installation.

what happened last week

Last week, several activities and updates occurred on the 1320 Mayfair project:

1. **Site Work and Deliveries**: The pavers team was on site, and more pavers and 89 stone were scheduled for delivery. The driveway prep was in progress, and the installation of pervious pavers was ongoing.

2. **Inspections and Reports**: The drywall team was working on sanding and finishing imperfections in the ceiling. Additionally, there was a focus on ensuring that the HVAC units were prepped for installation.

3. **Security Incident**: There was a report of a theft involving a Bosch chip hammer valued at $255, which was stolen from a nearby site. A police report was filed, and security measures were being discussed, including relocating cameras.

4. **Material Arrivals**: There were inquiries about the arrival of sliding door materials and Dekton slabs, with updates indicating that the materials were being fabricated.

5. **Team Coordination**: Various team members were assigned tasks, including spray painting gas lines and ensuring that specific materials were delivered and installed.

6. **Budget Tracking**: The project budget was being monitored, with actual costs reported at $801,185.52 against a total budget of $1,050,000.

For more detailed information on specific tasks or expenses, please let me know!

how much have we spent on the engineered floor system

The available budget and expense categories do not specifically list an "Engineered Floor System" line item, and there is no mention of it in the Slack messages or Asana tasks.

In the budget file, under "Quick Reference Tool", the "Engineer Floor System" entry shows a formula object, but no explicit cost figure is given. No transactions classified under this category appear in the input tab either.

Therefore, based on the current data sources, I couldn't find an exact amount spent on the engineered floor system for 1320 Mayfair.

If you need, I can assist further in searching specific vendor invoices or verifying if this cost is embedded within another category like "Foundation/Waterproofing" or "Framing." Let me know if you'd like me to look there.
what have we spent on foundation?

messages.content: what happened last week?

Last week, several activities took place at the 1253 Mayfair project site:

1. On April 24, 2025, Taka Shigematsu and Yakir Zaken adjusted the window and exterior door plans, which were then sent to Luz for updates. Dennis Trepanier reported that the T-pole inspection failed due to the absence of a grounding rod.

2. By April 28, 2025, Seminole Concrete had finished the forms, and the team was waiting for kitchen layout plans from Ron Z before the plumber could start on Wednesday. Ron Heller mentioned that the plumber would be scheduled for Wednesday, followed by an inspection, with the slab expected to be completed by the end of the next week.

3. On April 29, 2025, Ron Heller confirmed that Seminole had completed the box forms, and the site was ready for the plumber. Joel completed the ground rod installation, and Dennis Trepanier scheduled the T-pole for Wednesday.

These updates indicate progress in preparing the site for plumbing and electrical work, with a focus on inspections and form completion. The team is actively coordinating to ensure that all necessary components are in place for the next phase of construction, according to Ron Heller and Dennis Trepanier on April 28 and 29, 2025.
messages.citation: Ron Heller and Dennis Trepanier on April 28 and 29, 2025

messages.content: what happened yesterday?

Based on the provided messages, here is what happened yesterday:

- There was a theft involving Bosch Chip hammers valued at $255 at 1269 Mayfair, with a police report filed. The back sliding door was suspected to be the entry point, and security cameras were reinstalled after being down.  
- The police are actively investigating, and an inventory list of stolen items is being compiled.  
- The camera at the site was removed and is being relocated to 2387 Poplar.  
- The HVAC team was on their way to prep the AC units, scheduled to drop on Wednesday.  
- The drywall team was sanding and finishing ceiling imperfections.  
- Pavers were being delivered and installed, with backfill and grading in progress in the front yard.  
- Gravel installation was scheduled for tomorrow.  
- The team was working on various site preparations, including fixing the driveway, installing handles and pulls, and preparing for countertop templating.  
- Other ongoing activities included spray painting gas lines, fabricating sliding door materials, installing Dekton slabs, and working on electrical trim and other finishing tasks.

Please let me know if you need more specific details.

    • Edgar and Omar installed insulation fire blocking and Tyvek crew addressed exterior penetrations.
  2. Issues or Blockers
    • Need confirmation on siding order status.
    • Front door installation pending; requires concrete cutting.
    • Electrician start date is unclear.
  3. Upcoming Work
    • Bradley to perform Tyvek inspection.
    • Front door installation and rough electric work scheduled.
    • Bath fans to be ordered and delivered by Wednesday.
  4. Action Items
    • Todd: Adjust plans for additional 3 feet due to footing change.
    • Taka: Confirm siding elevation and order status with BFS.
    • Jim: Coordinate front door and insulation completion.
    • Rashad: Order seven bath fans as specified.

630 Carriage – Weekly Summary • Week 2025-W18 – Week Ending April 29, 2025

  1. Key Achievements
    • Sliding door installation was completed successfully.
    • Replacement of the middle dining room casement window was completed.
    • Work in the mudroom area was finished.
    • Jim Windows installer team completed most window installations on site.
  2. Issues or Blockers
    • Two outer dining room basement casement windows were found to be incorrectly sized and do not fit.
    • Window measurements sent were too tall by 2.5 inches; correct height is 67.5 inches but 70 inches were provided.
    • Jim window installation for these windows must be rescheduled pending reordering of the correct sizes.
  3. Upcoming Work
    • Travis will reconfirm all window measurements before reordering.
    • Replacement windows for incorrect sizes will need to be reordered and installed upon arrival.
    • Exterior finish, paint, and trim work still remain to be completed.
    • Drywall touch-ups are planned particularly around the dining room windows.
    • HVAC team scheduled to meet onsite with Paul at noon for coordination.
  4. Action Items
    • Travis to confirm window measurements onsite and coordinate with Jim Windows to re-order correct sizes.
    • Aaron to manage window replacement logistics and communicate with Paul regarding removal of incorrect windows.
    • Team to complete drywall touch-ups after window installation is finalized.
    • HVAC to proceed with scheduled meeting and continue coordination without additional representative needed onsite.

630 Carriage – Weekly Summary • Week 2025-W17 – Week Ending April 29, 2025

  1. Key Achievements
    • The sliding door installation was completed successfully.
    • The mudroom area work was completed.
    • The middle casement window in the dining room was replaced.
  2. Issues or Blockers
    • Incorrectly sized dining room casement windows were delivered and need reordering.
  3. Upcoming Work
    • Awaiting the report from the Jim Windows Installer team for further details on window sizing issues.
  4. Action Items
    • Coordinate with Jim Windows to resolve window sizing issues and reorder the correct sizes.
    • Follow up on the report from the Jim Windows Installer team for exact measurement details.

chatbot.name: Spark Expense Agent
chatbot.systemPrompt:
You are “Six Points Card ChargeBot”, a finance assistant for Six Points Homes.

SOURCE OF TRUTH  
• You receive only the Slack messages from channel #six-points-card (via MCP Server).  
• Ignore any other context unless explicitly provided.

GOAL  
1. Normal Mode (default): Parse each batch of Slack messages and output a list of every Spark-card charge or refund, following the OUTPUT FORMAT.  
2. Amount-Query Mode: If the user’s entire message is just a dollar amount (e.g., “$142.06” or “142.06”), search the last **7 days** of channel history.  
   • If an **exact amount** match is found, return that expense line (or multiple lines if more than one).  
   • If no exact match exists but you find an expense **within ± $5.00**, return it preceded by “Close match –”.  
   • If nothing is found, reply:  
      No expense matching $X.XX (±$5) was found in the last 7 days.  
   • Use the same Vendor / Amount / Description / Project formatting rules.

PARSING & NORMALISATION  
• If an employee omits the description, use **Material**.  
• Summarise multi-item descriptions briefly (e.g., “Electric Trim, bulbs”).  
• Format all amounts with commas for thousands (e.g., $1,133.39).  
• Refunds: prepend **REFUND** and show a negative amount (e.g., $-274.75).  
• Map vendor nicknames to full names:  
  ─ Home Depot ← HD, HDepot, Home D  
  ─ Lowe’s ← Lowes, lwes  
  ─ Sherwin Williams ← Sherwin, SH, SW  
  ─ Sunset Paint ← Sunset  
  ─ Atlanta Landscaping Material ← ALM, Atlanta Landscaping  
  ─ Brazilian Wood Depot ← Brazilian Wood, BW, Brazilian  
  ─ Floor and Decor ← FND, FD, Floor Decor  
  ─ Stovall ← Stovall  
  If only the vendor appears (e.g., “SH $46”), infer the obvious material (→ paint for Sherwin Williams).

PROJECT NAME RESOLUTION  
• Expand shorthand via the lookup list below (e.g., “2383” → 2383 Poplar).  
• If ambiguous (e.g., “Poplar” alone), set project to **UNKNOWN**.  
• “General Expense” → project **Six Points General**.

PROJECT LOOK-UP LIST  
4846 Adams • 160 Black Ankle • General Expense • 3023 Parkridge • 2367 Cortez • 125 Cromwell • 2688 Drew Valley • 6249 Ferry • 6265 Ferry • 1768 8th St • 1223 Mayfair • 1231 Mayfair • 1269 Mayfair • 1320 Mayfair • 1318 Hopkins • 2363 Nesbitt • 4845 Northway • 1644 Richwood • 2354 Poplar • 2383 Poplar • 2387 Poplar • 2393 Poplar • 2646 Cove • 1028 Citadel • 3197 Saybrook • 3187 Saybrook • 3871 Powers Ferry • 2540 Drew Valley • 2476 Drew Valley • 2461 Thompson • 630 Carriage • 195 Pebble • 2975 Westminster Circle • 2981 Westminster • 911 S Shore • 9157 Dickens • 3582 Avocado • 580 Elmwood • 1293 Sylvan

VALIDATION  
• In Normal Mode, output must follow the template exactly—one charge per line, newline-separated, with **Vendor  Amount  Description  “for”  Project**.  
• In Amount-Query Mode, output only the matching lines (or the close-match line), with no header.  
• Never add extra commentary, markdown, or blank lines.  
• If no matches (Normal Mode) reply:  
  No Spark-card charges were posted in #six-points-card during the specified period.
• Do not append author names, message dates, or any other metadata (e.g., “according to Ron Heller on 4/29/2025”) in either Normal Mode or Amount-Query Mode.
Follow the OUTPUT FORMAT below for all responses.
chatbot.outputFormat:
Normal Mode
------------
See below charges from messages between {{startDate}} and {{endDate}}:
[Vendor] $X,XXX.XX [description] for [Project Name]
[Vendor] $X,XXX.XX [description] for [Project Name]
REFUND [Vendor] $-X,XXX.XX [description] for [Project Name]
…(one line per charge, each ending with a newline)…

Amount-Query Mode
-----------------
[Vendor] $X,XXX.XX [description] for [Project Name]          ← exact match
Close match – [Vendor] $X,XXX.XX [description] for [Project Name]   ← ± $5 match

chatbot.name: Amex Expense Agent
chatbot.systemPrompt:
You are “Six Points Card ChargeBot”, a finance assistant for Six Points Homes.

SOURCE OF TRUTH  
• You receive only the Slack messages from channel #six-points-card (via MCP Server).  
• Ignore any other context unless explicitly provided.

GOAL  
1. Normal Mode (default): Parse each batch of Slack messages and output a list of every Spark-card charge or refund, following the OUTPUT FORMAT.  
2. Amount-Query Mode: If the user’s entire message is just a dollar amount (e.g., “$142.06” or “142.06”), search the last **7 days** of channel history.  
   • If an **exact amount** match is found, return that expense line (or multiple lines if more than one).  
   • If no exact match exists but you find an expense **within ± $5.00**, return it preceded by “Close match –”.  
   • If nothing is found, reply:  
      No expense matching $X.XX (±$5) was found in the last 7 days.  
   • Use the same Vendor / Amount / Description / Project formatting rules.

PARSING & NORMALISATION  
• If an employee omits the description, use **Material**.  
• Summarise multi-item descriptions briefly (e.g., “Electric Trim, bulbs”).  
• Format all amounts with commas for thousands (e.g., $1,133.39).  
• Refunds: prepend **REFUND** and show a negative amount (e.g., $-274.75).  
• Map vendor nicknames to full names:  
  ─ Home Depot ← HD, HDepot, Home D  
  ─ Lowe’s ← Lowes, lwes  
  ─ Sherwin Williams ← Sherwin, SH, SW  
  ─ Sunset Paint ← Sunset  
  ─ Atlanta Landscaping Material ← ALM, Atlanta Landscaping  
  ─ Brazilian Wood Depot ← Brazilian Wood, BW, Brazilian  
  ─ Floor and Decor ← FND, FD, Floor Decor  
  ─ Stovall ← Stovall  
  If only the vendor appears (e.g., “SH $46”), infer the obvious material (→ paint for Sherwin Williams).

PROJECT NAME RESOLUTION  
• Expand shorthand via the lookup list below (e.g., “2383” → 2383 Poplar).  
• If ambiguous (e.g., “Poplar” alone), set project to **UNKNOWN**.  
• “General Expense” → project **Six Points General**.

PROJECT LOOK-UP LIST

  – Construction materials and sediment were removed from the street per the NOV (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – Pavers and debris were also cleared from the roadway and driveway (Slack, 2025-05-01).  

• Kitchen / cooktop  
  – Prep for the cooktop was completed and the cut-in was in progress (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – The Elbrus/Pitt cooktop was tracked down at the office; coordination underway to have Vilma cut the countertop (Slack, 2025-04-29).  

• Doors & hardware  
  – The stationary door was fixed but its latch was missing; a replacement latch was ordered (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – A sliding-door latch was likewise ordered and is in transit (Slack, 2025-05-05).  

• Floor protection  
  – Gerardex was brought in to cover exposed flooring as a precaution (Slack, 2025-05-05).  

• Trim & finishes  
  – Plumbing trim-out was completed or wrapping up (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – Electric trim walkthrough held; electric trim work is slated to continue early this week (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – LED strips are on order for final trim (Slack, 2025-05-05).  

• Cabinetry & shelving  
  – Secondary closet shelves and cabinet pulls are in production with Christian Cabinetry; installation in master closet scheduled (Slack, 2025-05-05).  

• Cleaning  
  – A&G was on track to clean the home; stucco crew also tasked with cleaning exterior (Slack, 2025-05-05).  

• Walkthroughs & inspections  
  – Dimitri and Aaron conducted a site walk on Wednesday at 1 PM (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – Registers were opened and counts compared to Aaron’s list (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – Paint testing (“Greek Villa” SW-7551) and lime-wash scope reviewed for fireplace, TV wall, staircase, powder room (Slack, 2025-04-29).  

• Logistics & scheduling  
  – Triad scheduled for measurements; Radim’s exterior touch-up timing queried (Slack, 2025-05-01 & 2025-05-05).  
  – Premium Pella items to ship directly from Brennan’s office; shipping updates pending (Slack, 2025-05-05).  
  – Porta-John removal was requested (Slack, 2025-05-05).  

Let me know if you need more detail on any of these items.

summaries.content:
16 Bonnie – Weekly Summary • Week 2025-W18 – Week Ending April 29, 2025

  1. Key Achievements
    • NOV lifted after removal of materials and sediment from the street.
    • Cooktop prep and cut-in progress, with cooktop confirmed offsite at the office.
    • Plumbing trim completed and plumbing trim out in progress with Brandon on site.
    • Secondary shelves and cabinet pulls installation scheduled for master closet.
    • Home cleaning scheduled and underway by A&G and stucco team.
    • Walkthroughs completed with electric trim team; electric trim to continue early next week.
    • Stationary door fixed; new latch ordered for sliding door.
    • Debris removal and site cleaning completed including pavers removed from road and driveway.
  2. Issues or Blockers
    • Some exterior touch-ups missed last week pending completion.
    • Sliding door latch lost by installation team and currently on order and in transit.
    • LED strips required for final installation are still on order.
    • Need for multiple workers to assist with moving the tub upstairs.
  3. Upcoming Work
    • Electric trim continuation scheduled for Friday and early next week.
    • Christian to install secondary closet shelving and finish master closet trim Monday.
    • Brandon to continue plumbing trim installation tomorrow.
    • Gerardex requested to cover exposed flooring for protection.
    • Schedule countertop cutting and related installation.
    • Notification to remove porta john after site re-cleaning.
  4. Action Items
    • Aaron to coordinate cooktop delivery and schedule Vilma for cooktop cut-out.
    • Rashad to confirm arrival of all electric materials and assist with onsite material handling.
    • Christian to complete installation of master closet secondary shelves and cabinet pulls.
    • Brandon to continue plumbing trim out and provide drainage and sewage caps.
    • All teams to verify all materials are onsite and accounted for prior to upcoming installations.
